Name: ophthalmomyiasis
Definition: A myiasis that involves parasitic infestation of Oestrus ovis larvae in the eye causing severe irritation

Name: Aland Island eye disease
Definition: An eye disease characterized by fundus hypopigmentation

Name: ocular albinism
Definition: An eye disease that is characterized by reduced pigmentation of the iris and the resulting impairment of visual acuity without significantly affecting the color of skin or hair and has_material_basis in mutation in the GPR143 gene that encodes segments of the melanosomes that stores melanin.

Name: Cogan syndrome
Definition: An eye disease characterized by nonsyphilitic interstitial keratitis located_in cornea

Name: Cogan-Reese syndrome
Definition: An eye disease characterized by variable iris atrophy

Name: ptosis
Definition: An eye disease characterized by the drooping or falling of the upper or lower eyelid.

Name: anterior segment dysgenesis
Definition: An eye disease that is characterized by iris hypoplasia

Name: pigment dispersion syndrome
Definition: An eye disease characterized by slit-like depigmented areas of the iris with up to 50% of patients going on to develop glaucoma.

Name: Sveinsson chorioretinal atrophy
Definition: An eye disease characterized by presence in the fundus of progressive bilateral retinal and choroidal atrophy leading to central vision loss that has_material_basis_in heterozygous muation in TEAD1 on 11p15.3.

Name: eye accommodation disease
Definition: An eye disease that is characterized by decreased ability to change the optical power of the eye to maintain a clear image.

Name: cysticercosis
Definition: A taeniasis that results from ingestion of eggs or larvae of the Taenia solium tapeworm in undercooked pork or fecally contaminated food or water

Name: corneal disease
Definition: An eye disease that affects the cornea

Name: asthenopia
Definition: A vein disease that is characterized by impaired flow of blood through the veins.

Name: obsolete Chlamydia trachomatis peritonitis
Definition: A vein disease that is characterized by impaired flow of blood through the veins.
Synonym: venereal disease of peritoneum due to Chlamydia trachomatis

Name: obsolete secondary malignant neoplasm to the thymus
Definition: A vein disease that is characterized by impaired flow of blood through the veins.

Name: obsolete metastases to mediastinum
Definition: A vein disease that is characterized by impaired flow of blood through the veins.

Name: neuroretinitis
Definition: An ischemic bone disease that results_in necrosis located_in bone.

Name: amblyopia
Definition: A primary bacterial infectious disease that results in infection located in skin

Name: microphthalmia
Definition: An eye disease where one or both eyeballs are abnormally small.

Name: lens disease
Definition: An eye disease that affects the lens of the eye

Name: trachoma
Definition: A commensal bacterial infectious disease that results_in infection located_in eye

Name: scleral disease
Definition: An eye disease that affects the sclera

Name: obsolete congenital osteodystrophy
Definition: An eye disease that affects the sclera

Name: obsolete Meniere's disease in remission
Definition: An eye disease that affects the sclera

Name: obsolete epilepsia partialis continua
Definition: An eye disease that affects the sclera

Name: obsolete grand mal status epilepticus
Definition: An eye disease that affects the sclera

Name: obsolete epilepsia partialis continua with intractable epilepsy
Definition: An eye disease that affects the sclera

Name: coloboma
Definition: An eye disease characterized by missing pieces of tissue in structures that form the eye

Name: globe disease
Definition: An eye disease that involves the globe of the eye.

Name: loiasis
Definition: A filariasis that involves parasitic infection of the skin and eyes caused by the nematode Loa loa

Name: obsolete candidal endocarditis
Definition: A candidiasis that results_in inflammation located_in endocardium

Name: obsolete candidal otitis externa
Definition: A candidiasis that involves fungal infection of the outer ear canal caused by Candida species. The symptoms include discharge

Name: obsolete candidal enteritis
Definition: A candidiasis that involves infection of the small intestine caused by Candida species

Name: visual pathway disease
Definition: An eye disease that affects the neural pathway from the optic nerve to the visual cortex

Name: lacrimal apparatus disease
Definition: An eye disease that affects the lacrimal apparatus (the lacrimal gland and its related structures) which moisten and drain the eye.

Name: blindness
Definition: An eye disease characterized by a lack or loss of vision.

Name: dipetalonemiasis
Definition: A filariasis that is a zoonotic infection caused by the nematode of the genus Dipetalonema

Name: Axenfeld-Rieger syndrome
Definition: An autosomal dominant disease characterized by abnormalities of the front part of the eye

Name: glaucoma
Definition: An eye disease that is characterized by an unstable or a sustained increase in the intraocular pressure which the eye cannot withstand without damage to its structure or impairment of its function.

Name: ocular cancer
Definition: A sensory system cancer located_in the eye that is characterized by uncontrolled cellular proliferation in the eye.

Name: pupil disease
Definition: A multiple sclerosis that is characterized by relapse (attacks of symptom flare-ups) followed by remission (periods of recovery). Symptoms may vary from mild to severe

Name: obsolete Vibrio cholerae O1 biovar El Tor cholera
Definition: A cholera that involves infection of the intestine caused by Vibrio cholerae serogroup O1 biovar El Tor.
Synonym: Vibrio cholerae O1 biovar eltor cholera

Name: uveal disease
Definition: An eye disease affecting the uvea

Name: conjunctival disease
Definition: An eye disease affecting the conjunctiva

Name: retinal disease
Definition: An eye disease that is located_in the retina.

Name: ocular hypotension
Definition: A parasitic ectoparasitic infectious disease that involves infestation of mites belonging to the family Sarcoptidae

Name: fundus dystrophy
Definition: A lower respiratory tract disease in which the function of the lungs is adversely affected by narrowing or blockage of the airways resulting in poor air flow

Name: chorioretinitis
Definition: A parasitic helminthiasis infectious disease that involves parasitic infection of the intestine by Fasciolopsis buski. The symptoms include diarrhea

Name: obsolete inborn metabolic brain disease
Definition: A parasitic helminthiasis infectious disease that involves parasitic infection of the intestine by Fasciolopsis buski. The symptoms include diarrhea

Name: ocular hypertension
Definition: An eye disease that is characterized by elevated intraocular pressure in the absence of optic nerve damage or visual field loss.

Name: scotoma
Definition: A parasitic helminthiasis infectious disease that involves infection by parasitic flatworms known as tapeworms living in the vertebrate digestive tract.
Synonym: Sector or arcuate visual field defects

Name: keratoconjunctivitis
Definition: An asthma that is a life threatening condition with progressive respiratory failure

Name: exophthalmos
Definition: An eye disease that is characterized by a bulging of the eye anteriorly out of the orbit.

Name: obsolete postural kyphosis
Definition: A kyphosis that has_material_basis_in slouching which results_in stretching of spinal ligament and abnormal formation located_in vertebra.

Name: ophthalmia nodosa
Definition: An eye and adnexa disease that is located in the vitreous of the eye.

Name: eye degenerative disease
Definition: A parasitic helminthiasis infectious disease that involves zoonotic infection of humans by the larvae of Toxocara canis or Toxocara cati. The larvae invade multiple tissues like liver

Name: obsolete staphylococcal infectious disease
Definition: A parasitic helminthiasis infectious disease that involves zoonotic infection of humans by the larvae of Toxocara canis or Toxocara cati. The larvae invade multiple tissues like liver

Name: refractive error
Definition: A withdrawal disorder that is characterized by a group of problems that occur in a newborn who was exposed to addictive illegal or prescription drugs while in the mother's womb or postnatally following the discontinuance of drug treatment.

Name: obsolete refraction or accommodation disorder
Definition: A withdrawal disorder that is characterized by a group of problems that occur in a newborn who was exposed to addictive illegal or prescription drugs while in the mother's womb or postnatally following the discontinuance of drug treatment.
